column4: Hi, I just did a fresh install of ubuntu edgy then a system update, I need to have these installed - Linux 2.6 kernel with kernel sources (or headers), GCC Compiler, Binutils, GNU Make, GTK/GLIB 2.0 libraries - can someone please give me a command to get all this stuff?
Use Synaptic and find the packages
-- do you know what they're called?
Just filter the list by name
If you need the 2.6 kernel, just type linux kernel into the list, it'll show you a list of all packages relating to the kernel.
If you need gcc, type gcc.
Though, to get gcc, binutils, make, you might just be able to do sudo apt-get install build-essential
I think that grabs GCC, G++, Make, etc.
-- wil that get me Linux 2.6 kernel with kernel sources (or headers) and GTK/GLIB 2.0 libraries ?
Nope.
Those are separate BeepAU.
-- how can i get them?
For the kernel, you need to know exactly which kernel version you need, and the command would be something like sudo apt-get install linux-kernel-2.6.x.x-image or something like that.
Using Synaptic is better, just filter the list.
-- $ uname -r gets me 2.6.17-11-generic
Well, you already have the 2.6 kernel then.
You don't need another kernel. :)
--what about the kernel sources or headers thing?
And if you're running Ubuntu, you have Gnome, so you probably have GTK 2+
Um, try sudo apt-get install linux-kernel-2.6.17-11-sources or something.
I'm telling you, use Synaptic....
-- i'll search in synaptic
